problem_text:
Let F be the formation of all finite groups all of whose composition factors are isomorphic to some fixed simple non-abelian group T. Prove that F is indecomposable into a product of two non-trivial subformations.
L. A. Shemetkov
answer: It is proved (O. V. Mel’nikov, Problems in Algebra, 9, Gomel’, 1996, 42–47 (Russian)).
